instruction: How were machine learning models utilized in the related study to discriminate dynamic gait-adjustment intention using cerebral hemoglobin signals obtained from subjects?
Output:
In the related study, machine learning models were utilized to discriminate dynamic gait-adjustment intention using cerebral hemoglobin signals obtained from subjects. The authors used the gradient boosting decision tree (GBDT) model to detect the onset of self-regulated intention. The GBDT model had a good performance with an average AUC (Area Under Curve) of 0.894 in detecting the onset intention.

Furthermore, the authors proposed a 2-layer-GA-SVM (Genetic Algorithm-Support Vector Machine) model based on stacking algorithm to identify the four types of self-regulated intention: speed increase, speed reduction, step increase, and step reduction. The 2-layer-GA-SVM model improved the average accuracy (ACC) of intention recognition from 70.6% to 84.4% (p = 0.005) compared to the single GA-SVM model.

Overall, the machine learning models, GBDT and 2-layer-GA-SVM, were used to analyze the cerebral hemoglobin signals and classify the different types of gait-adjustment intentions.
